 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
SECTION HEADINGS(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

Section headings are used to organize the content. 

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
A Web application contains a settings page that is divided into groups of
related settings. Each section contains a heading describing the class of
settings. Iâ€™d like to know a little more
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/section-headings.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 05 October 2023 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2023/REC-WCAG22-20231005/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
